allow: Bash(for dataset in bqx_bq_uscen1 bqx_ml_v3_features bqx_ml_v3_models bqx_ml_v3_predictions bqx_ml_v3_analytics bqx_ml_v3_staging)
Bash(for bucket in gs://bqx-ml-v3-models gs://bqx-ml-bqx-ml-artifacts gs://bqx-ml-bqx-ml-results)

Bash(bq --location=us-central1 query --use_legacy_sql=false --format=csv "
SELECT table_name
FROM \`bqx-ml.bqx_ml_v3_features.INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES\`
WHERE table_name LIKE ''%eurusd%''
ORDER BY table_name
")
Bash(for table in agg_eurusd reg_eurusd mom_eurusd vol_eurusd der_eurusd align_eurusd)
Bash(do echo "Deleting: $table" bq rm -f bqx-ml:bqx_ml_v3_features.$table done)

Bash(for table in all_pairs_poly_correlation_matrix extreme_correlation_results extreme_sample_5000 extreme_targets extreme_windows_301 feature_correlation_ranking full_correlation_matrix full_correlation_matrix_v2 new_poly_correlation_matrix top100_extreme_features)

PARADIGM_SHIFT_2024_11_24.CRITICAL: BQX values can now be used as BOTH features AND targets
PARADIGM_SHIFT_2024_11_24.OLD_RULE: BQX values were restricted to targets only
PARADIGM_SHIFT_2024_11_24.NEW_RULE: BQX values (bqx_ask, bqx_bid, bqx_mid) can be features AND targets
PARADIGM_SHIFT_2024_11_24.IMPACT: Include BQX lags in feature engineering for autoregressive prediction

UPDATED_CRITICAL_MANDATES.1_BQX_USAGE: BQX values can be BOTH features AND targets (paradigm shift!)
UPDATED_CRITICAL_MANDATES.2_INTERVAL_CENTRIC: Use ROWS BETWEEN only, NEVER time-based windows
UPDATED_CRITICAL_MANDATES.4_AIRTABLE_TRUTH: P03 is the single source of truth for all work

feature_engineering_update.rationale: Historical BQX values contain momentum signals that predict future BQX

current_tasks: Create lag_bqx_* tables WITH BQX features (paradigm shift)
Create regime_bqx_* tables including BQX regimes
Create agg_bqx_* tables with BQX aggregations
Create align_bqx_* tables with all features including BQX
validation_rules_updated: Check: BQX features ARE present in feature columns (paradigm shift)
Check: All windows use ROWS BETWEEN
context.sql_template_updated: CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE bqx_ml.lag_bqx_[pair] AS SELECT *, LAG(close, 1) OVER (ORDER BY bar_start_time) AS close_lag_1, LAG(bqx_mid, 1) OVER (ORDER BY bar_start_time) AS bqx_mid_lag_1 /* NEW! */, ... FROM bqx_ml.regression_bqx_[pair]
